byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Tampa, and Alan Rappeport and Jonathan Martin from Cleveland.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK, ALAN RAPPEPORT and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Rodham Clinton picks Sen Tim Kaine of Virginia to be her running mate; Kaine has working-class roots and is fluent in Spanish, traits that Clinton believes can bolster her chances to defeat Donald J Trump in general election.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Kaine, a former governor of Virginia who is now on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, speaks fluent Spanish and has a strong friendship with Mrs. Clinton.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Selects Tim Kaine, a Popular Senator From a Swing State, as Running Mate
headline.print_headline: Clinton Names a Senator as Vice-Presidential Pick

snippet: Mr. Kaine, a former governor of Virginia who is now on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, speaks fluent Spanish and has a strong friendship with Mrs. Clinton....
